title: Herbalife Releases Second Global Sustainability Report :: Herbalife Ltd. (HLF) - Investor Relations :: Herbalife Ltd. (HLF)
summary: Herbalife released its second Global Sustainability Report, highlighting its commitments to product quality, healthy people and communities, and a thriving planet. The report covers impacts made from 2021-2022 and provides transparency into its sustainable business practices. Herbalife has made progress in reducing its environmental impact, supporting healthy lifestyles, and giving back to communities.

title: East Penn Manufacturing power a closed loop circular economy - Sustainability Magazine
summary: East Penn Manufacturing, founded in 1946, is one of the world's leading battery manufacturers and has sustainability at the core of its operations. The company recycles all three major parts of a lead battery (plastic, lead, and acid), closing the loop with its distribution system that collects used batteries for recycling when delivering new products. East Penn Manufacturing is committed to procuring 15 megawatts of renewable electricity over a 15-year period through a solar energy project.

title: PFAS Anyone? - Textile World Magazine
summary: Consumers are increasingly demanding products that have a lower environmental impact, and this has led to a rise in green innovation. Green innovation can take many forms, from new products and processes to new ways of doing business. One example of green innovation is the development of new materials that are more sustainable than traditional materials. Another example is the development of new processes that use less energy or water. Green innovation is not just good for the environment, it can also be good for business. Companies that are seen as being environmentally friendly are more likely to attract customers and investors.

green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: Why DE&I is Key to Business Sustainability: Considerations for Incorporating It into Your Plan - Security Management Magazine
summary: Companies that prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) are more likely to be successful in the long run. DE&I can help companies attract and retain talent, increase employee engagement, and foster innovation. The security industry can work together to improve DE&I through industry associations and working groups.

title: All the latest on ethically sourced ingredients - dairyfoods.com
summary: The article discusses the growing demand for ethically sourced ingredients in dairy products, driven by evolving consumer and corporate interests in sustainability and environmental responsibility. Processors are increasingly seeking suppliers that adhere to ethical sourcing practices, including animal welfare, environmental stewardship, and worker treatment. To meet consumer expectations and achieve ESG goals, companies are implementing responsible sourcing policies and programs, and communicating their commitment to ethical sourcing to consumers.

title: Task force to tackle construction waste in Manitoba - Daily Commercial News
summary: Construction, renovation and demolition (CRD) activities represent one of the largest waste streams in Manitoba. A new task force is hoping to change that by exploring ways Manitoba can move toward greater recycling of CRD waste materials, diverting them from landfills and producing new products for use in a variety of ways. The task force will examine whatâ€™s working well and consider options from other Canadian jurisdictions surrounding the reuse and recycling of construction materials.

title: Expansion of Evonik's methionine production capacity in Singapore moves to next stage - Aquafeed.com
summary: Evonik is expanding its DL-methionine production plant in Singapore, which will require production shutdowns in Q4/2023 and H1/2024. The expansion will increase production capacity by 40,000 metric tons per year and reduce the carbon footprint of the facility's processes by 6%. The company is investing a high double-digit million-euro amount in the expansion.

title: Jindal Group Makes a Grand Comeback: Snaps up Sohar Steel After Three-Year Break - ChemAnalyst
summary: Jindal Group has acquired Sohar Steel, a steel plant in Oman, after a three-year break. The acquisition will help the group to expand its presence in the steel industry and contribute to the development of Oman's economy. Jindal Group is committed to sustainability and will use its expertise to improve the environmental performance of Sohar Steel.
